title: Installation issue: glib
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue
Fails to build if there are any switches/options in the ldflags: section of your compilers.yaml file.
Might be related to https://wiki.gentoo.org/wiki/Project:Quality_Assurance/As-needed#Failure_in_compile.2C_unrecognized_option ?

However I couldn't replicate from outside of spack (built successfully in a simplified config but with same ldflags).

```console
$ spack install glib
...
```

### Information on your system

* **Spack:** 0.16.0
* **Python:** 3.8.7
* **Platform:** linux-sles15-zen2

compiler.yaml file includes modifications to ldflags: -fPIC -Wl,--disable-new-dtags

### Additional information

The relevant section from spack-build-out.txt:
[856/1217] /apps_pearcey_sles15/spack/0.16.0/lib/spack/env/ld -r -b binary gio/tests/test5.gresource -o gio/tests/test_resources.o
FAILED: gio/tests/test_resources.o
/apps_pearcey_sles15/spack/0.16.0/lib/spack/env/ld -r -b binary gio/tests/test5.gresource -o gio/tests/test_resources.o
ld: -f may not be used without -shared

### General information
Not sure if this should be in packages or bugs @michaelkuhn 

- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mentioned any maintainers
- [] I have uploaded the build log and environment files
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
